articles.title: Modric the dream catcher: if Milan is still in the running for the Scudetto, they owe it to their immense champion

articles.title: Allegri to TL: "It's one victory less to reach the final goal. What a champion Modric!"
articles.summary: Speaking to Telelombardia after the 2-1 win at Pisa, Massimiliano Allegri explained: "These are important points to move up in the standings. It's one less victory to reach the final objective."

articles.title: Tuttosport opening: "Modric's class makes Milan dream again"

articles.title: CorSera: "Modric ageless genius keeps the Milan dream alive"
articles.summary: In the aftermath of the Rossoneri's 2-1 victory at Pisa, the Corriere della Sera headlined this morning: "Modric, an ageless genius, keeps the Milan dream alive".

articles.title: Pisa beaten, but what a pain. CorSport on the front page: "Milan advances: they are now at -5"
articles.summary: Corriere dello Sport wrote on the front page this morning regarding yesterday's hard-fought victory for the Rossoneri at Pisa: "Milan advances: they are now -5".

articles.title: The opening of the Gazzetta: "Stroke of genius. Modric brings Milan back to -5 from Inter"
articles.summary: Today's edition of the Gazzetta dello Sport headlines this morning on the front page: "Stroke of genius. Modric brings Milan back to -5 behind Inter".

articles.title: Eternal Luka: Milan's championship dream is still alive thanks to Modric
articles.summary: Mission accomplished, but what an effort: Milan had to win last night in Pisa and they did, but those who thought it could be a walk in the park were very wrong.

articles.title: Who does Allegri support? Inter or Juventus? Here is the coach's blunt answer
articles.summary:
Mister Massimiliano Allegri spoke to DAZN at the end of Pisa-Milan 1-2.

Is it better for Juventus or Inter to lose points tomorrow?

“The important thing is that we scored 3 points.

At 40 years and 5 months you kept the championship open. Are you the strongest over 40 ever?
